title: The hard truth about the Facebook ad boycott: Nothing matters but Zuckerberg
text: For years, Facebook has been viewed as one of the only truly indispensable digital advertising platforms for big and small businesses looking to reach the social network's vast audience. Even as the company lurched from one controversy to the next, and endured viral hashtags calling for users to delete the app, its advertising machine kept churning out money, making Facebook seem all but unstoppable.

title: Facebook will label newsworthy posts that break rules as ad boycott widens

title: Who gains the most from Mixer's closure?
text: Microsoft spent the last year aggressively promoting it's streaming service, Mixer. Part of this plan involved courting high-profile Twitch streamers with multi-million dollar exclusivity deals.  With all this spending, it came as somewhat of a shock when Microsoft announced they'll be shuttering the service in July.
